page.title: 01Our D-block
page.content:
Our twelve kilometre D-block is a mixture of land and sea being found on the South-east coast of England. Our school,{Palmarsh CP School,}is more or less in the centre of our D-block with the North Downs as a back-cloth to us to the north and the{English Channel to the South. Between the Channel and us is the{Hythe Ranges}within which are two{Martello Towers}and a Ridout. To the West of us, is the{gravel {quarry}while to the East the historic {Cinque Port of Hythe}is found.
During the day, especially through the summer, school life is enlivened by the hooting of one of the twelve railway engines that run along the famous{Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch {Railway}which passes a stone's throw along the rear of the school alongside the{Royal Military Canal.}
